SEARCH
Package dev.Pedro.movies_api.logging.configuration

Class LoggingSettingBeans

java.lang.Object
dev.Pedro.movies_api.logging.configuration.LoggingSettingBeans
@Configuration public class LoggingSettingBeans extends Object

Configuration class that defines Spring beans for managing asynchronous logging to Mongo Database.

Provides a customized ThreadPoolExecutor bean configured with parameters that handle the execution of logging tasks into the database.

Also defines a bounded BlockingQueue (LinkedBlockingQueue) to buffer LogEvent objects before they are processed, sized and batched according to the configured buffer capacity and batching size.

    • LoggingSettingBeans

  • Method Details

    • logExecutor

      @Bean(name="logExecutor", destroyMethod="shutdown") public ThreadPoolExecutor logExecutor(LoggingVariables threadProperties)
      Creates a ThreadPoolExecutor bean named "logExecutor" for processing logging tasks. The thread pool parameters are injected from LoggingVariables. Also, when the shutdown method is launched, this bean will be destroyed.
      Parameters:
      threadProperties - configuration properties for thread pool behavior.
      Returns:
      a configured ThreadPoolExecutor instance.

    • logBuffer

      @Bean public BlockingQueue<LogEvent> logBuffer(LoggingVariables bufferProperties)
      Creates a bounded BlockingQueue (LinkedBlockingQueue) bean named "logBuffer" to hold LogEvent instances. This queue serves as a buffer for asynchronous logging, temporarily storing log events before they are batched and saved to the database. The buffer capacity is set based on configuration properties.
      Parameters:
      bufferProperties - configuration properties providing the buffer capacity
      Returns:
      a LinkedBlockingQueue with the configured capacity
